website_summaries.verdict: A popular brand with impressive features, but if you'd rather have better night vision than some of its bells and whistles, check out others on our list.
pros: 1,000 ft. range and video capabilities are ideal for watching nature and events at a distance
cons: Night vision can be difficult to focus and isn't as reliable as others we considered
Larger and less portable than some competitors

customer_reviews.title: WARNING--- SELLER DID NOT HONOR AMAZON RETURN POLICY
customer_reviews.text: The night vision worked well at day break and twilight--but when pitch black at night, I could see very little except what in areas where there was some moonlight. I have trust Bushnell products in the past, including my rangefinder and my son's binoculars, but they should call this product "Low light vision monocular" not "night vision monocular." Product seems sturdy and very clear but not at night. Worst thing is that Bushnell ignored me when I sent the product back--I have USPS proof of delivery but they still have the product and my money-- I lost more than $240 purchasing this Bushnell product through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Erikson

customer_reviews.title: Huge undocumented feature!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Excellent at anything less than 50 meters. After that, the picture quality gets grainy, but that it to be expected. The IR light gets dispersed with distance. **Huge undocumented feature! I was eating through batteries and then discovered that it can be powered via the mini-USB port. I attached a Limefuel Blast L60X for $30 and it lasts for hours and hours at the highest settings. Any USB charger should work. Connect the charger to AC and you can run this all night without having to worry about batteries. I've no idea why they don't integrate or advertise this.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life, not ideal for hunting or night ops.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries only last 2 hours max, using high quality lithium and the unit shuts off every 5 minutes. Disappointing because there’s no way to remain completely stealth when having to constantly turn it back on and replacing batteries. I just returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Selena S.

customer_reviews.title: It's Been Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Night Vision, gizmo, the 6x is just that, you can't go to less than 6x so if you expect to view in the woods like what we have here in Michigan don't think this will work at all, now if you want to look out across the hay field at night out to about 275 yards for coyotes this thing rocks, with a moon you don't need the IR light turned on. It's a bit coarse in its resolution so the digital 1-3x (which is 6x + 1-3 power) does help at times on those pesky little things moving around at night. Would I recommend it to a friend, Yes
customer_reviews.author: DaveH...

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell is not into quality anymore
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to focus. This is the second device I have purchased that would. Not focus. I thought with a name like Bushnell I expected more. My cheaper SOLOMARK works great. I wanted the Bushnell because it had a rail to attach an IR flashlight to, but I had to return it. Maybe black Friday will get me a better deal on a better one. Some say they had a good experience, so take a chance if you must.
customer_reviews.author: Haddo

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell will not stand behind their warranty
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit one year used it twice. 3rd time would not power on. Sent it back, and they sent me an email stating it was working as intended, and they were sending it back. When I got it back there was a letter they thought the batteries were left in it, and I should purchase a replacement. Of course this was after I paid the shipping both ways. I saw no corrosion, but hey, they got their money. I won't be fooled again.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN H. WOOD

customer_reviews.title: In an open area it works great - 700 feet
customer_reviews.text: Gen 1 technology updated. Not a true view as you are actually viewing an LCD image produced on a screen. Major "washout" issue (IR light reflects back from trees, leaves, any object really) so distance viewing is a problem. The only practical use I can see is for open field, nighttime viewing. In an open area it works great - 700 feet, easily. Mountable on tri-pod or weapon rail system. Little pricey for a backyard kids toy for critters. Cheap alternative if your hunting at night in an open field.
customer_reviews.author: mp mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Low quality digitized image
customer_reviews.text: The field of vision is too narrow at this magnification for scanning and locating objects. The focusing mechanism is unusually difficult, compounding the first issue. The image, once located and focused, is a very poor quality and is highly digitized. This product would be best used on a fixed stand (tripod) for stationary objects located by other means. This item is not effectively usable as a handheld night optic. Expectations were low at this price point so I tried 3 different brands between $200 and $300. The Bushnell was the most expensive and the poorest performer. Do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 hour run time they say?
customer_reviews.text: They claim this until has a 6 hour run time with the IR on? More like 40 mins with the IR on lowest setting. I tried Enloops, Energizers, rechargeables and alkaline. I covered the spectrum and the best time was 40 mins? That's reduculous there are much better options!!
customer_reviews.author: Randall BryanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: The view was very limited and not at all like the images I saw on the website when I ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned it after one day. The view was very limited and not at all like the images I saw on the website when I did research. Never could get it focused just right - decided it wasn't worth the hassle. Vendor was GREAT - gave an immediate refunds, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marlowe

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell No Bueno
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to like this scope. I was surprised at how small it was. I am familiar with digital NV scopes and have a Sightmark Photon that I hunt pigs with and REALLY like. The Bushnell was clumsy (buttons are too close together, which you MIGHT get use to), but deer that I can easily see with my Photon, were invisible blobs with the Bushnell. I tried everything at both ends and the buttons to no avail. It looks great. It just had lousy performance. I would call the image at night crude compared to the Sightmark. I still want a digital spotting scope, but this isn't it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: CSATEXAS

customer_reviews.title: It works. It is a telescope. Expect telescope results. I do recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The distance for viewing is unbelievably long . However, the actual view is very small. Love the fact that it is AA operated ! I do recommend.It is priced about right. Covers fit well and are very useful. IR is strong and goes the full distance of viewing area! It works. It is a telescope. Expect telescope results. With that said, I would have given it more stars but the viewing area is so small.
customer_reviews.author: Batman🦇

customer_reviews.title: Great night time monocular with bright IR illumination.
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, stats on 24x7 under usb power, use it to record night time wildlife and then do video analytics to see coyote. Rabbit, and wildlife varieties for conservation purposes. It's on a heavy tripod and after a video stabilization pass thru filter to remove the heat waves, wind shakes, and usual night time video artifacts, it has a stable video stream out to about 200 ft(70meters?) And can tell between coyotes and dogs, and closer in details to see I individual animals for research and cataloging by behaviours, so we can tell the bad actors fast.
customer_reviews.author: Swordwright the majic user

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Low Budget NV Scope
customer_reviews.text: Yes, you can take video with sound and pictures if you add a micro SD card. And that may come in handy some day, I guess. But I bought this as a low budget way to see in the dark for safe movement in an emergency. Surveillance is a backup function. At this price point, you won't find a better option. This is a great value. It has a Pic rail and a camera tripod mount (neg/fem). Nice features that add versatility. Comes with a respectable carry/storage case, but you may want a rugged plastic case with foam insert or make a Faraday cage out of an old ammo can lined with closed cell foam. Just a suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: Coyote Down!
customer_reviews.text: Man, Has Bushnell changed their quality. This thing is great! A must have for a hunter. Can watch you feeders before the sun comes up and at dusk it's great! The first night I took it out at 1:30am. Spotted a Coyote and Bam! My hunting buddies are getting the one.
customer_reviews.author: John Ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: Great night vision monocul.
customer_reviews.text: The Bushnell Equinox Z is perfect for my requirements of looking into my yard that ends about 350 feet behind my hours and more than double that in front. The Bushnell provides me with a distinct vision of what is stationary or moving around my yard in the complete dark. The only issue I see is that the batteries can be quickly drained so I recommend a customer to also get an Lithium battery pack that will allow you to plug the Equinox into and will extend the battery and viewing time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing 'Must-Have' Tool
customer_reviews.text: The item was packaged well, received in a timely manner and appeared/functioned exactly as described. I'm a deputy sheriff in a rural area, and I am *very* impressed with its performance in'pitch dark. I strongly encourage anyone who hunts or works in security/law enforcement to have one of these. My ONLY criticisms (perhaps unfair criticisms) are: (1) the scope isn't detachable from the lens, so if you're wanting to see something up close, this won't work; and (2) when you use the camera feature, the picture is of noticeably lower quality; (3) whatever you're looking at will see a red light emanating from the device, thus revealing your location.
customer_reviews.author: Same Ole - SE MO

customer_reviews.title: For Hobbyists, Not Wannabe Rambos
customer_reviews.text: This is for watching animals at night or checking out areas nearby that are rather dark. Mounting on a rifle or helmet for night ops? You will be very unhappy with the results and probably fall and hurt yourself. There is no such thing as good, but cheap night vision. Pros: Surprisingly clear picture Excellent zoom Easy to use Range- I can see 200-300 yards Cons: Needs IR illuminator most of the time Cannot use illuminator thru glass Eats batteries
customer_reviews.author: Hot Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: Quality product from Bushnell
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the money. Device is not true night vision for it uses technology used in night vision security cameras, but that is reason for low cost and affordability. Rugged construction for using outdoors in wet conditions and is completely rubberized to help prevent damage to unit if dropped. Best to use lithium batteries for longer life, but with it using AA batteries it is economical to use versus C123 batteries. Good product to use for homeowner to check area around house or in buildings without lights, security services or law enforcement. I like the ability to take a single photo or video.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Deer can see the red light. Just had 2 bucks run off from it
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great except deer can see the red light for infrared. Will be returning due to they said it was just a small red light not a dang cue beam
customer_reviews.author: fishing

customer_reviews.title: Made in China! Not good quality but get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Box says capable of viewing 750 feet or 250 yards but our experience was more like 50 feet due to light glare off of other obstacles in sight path preventing further viewing at night total darkness which is why we purchased. Works good for open field or yard at night with no trees in sight path for night vision infrared light to glare off of preventing further field of view. Sent it back. Also to many features for no better than it performs.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Senft

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong for someone just starting out for purchasing night vision. Digital over traditional NV is the way to go. Wish I would of known prior to spending funds on other purchases before this one. Would of saved over the long run. Mounted mine on a dedicated predator gun and matched with a red dot sight. Long distance viewing and clear imagery, surpasses gen 1 and 2 NV and quarter of the cost. Only negative would be battery/indicator. When IR is on, the battery level drops to one bar; however, don't think it's accurate as I still keep it on for hours and the battery does not go dead. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Wazzy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Bushnell.
customer_reviews.text: I received this product and used it in my backyard at night. I have a wooded area and deer come through there often. This night there were 4 deer the only way I could make them out was if they were looking my way eyes shining, moving or standing up in the open. I tried adjusting the heck out of the monocular. No luck. I didn't like the view through the eyepiece, it's a tube then a small TV screen which isn't very big and hard to see through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For use outdoors/ Wildlife intended
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it was just ok. This would be for outdoor use only, as it is 3X. It is disorienting even on its dim setting. It is also visible to others opposite your position. To view wildlife this is sufficient. For a tactical advantage, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device for the money. It is not a visible-light amplification device--without the infrared illuminator, it won't function in a dark environment. However, with the illuminator on, it gives a clearer image than Gen1 night vision, the image is black-and-white rather than the eerie green, and the best thing is that you can't burn it out by turning it on or taking it out into daylight without the lens caps on!
customer_reviews.author: SailFree

customer_reviews.title: Not getting to use it,  biggest disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I almost wish my kids cat stayed lost I really wish I got a chance to use this. It felt and looked like it was very well made, and I wish I could afford this just to have for no reason but the wife seen it when it arrived (after the cat who had been missing for 22 hours showed up on its own) so unfortunately we decided "together" to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Big Frost Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for watching wildlife at night. I was able toook a couple hundred yards across a corn field and see a rabbit in the middle of the night, the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it eats batteries
customer_reviews.author: Tjs

customer_reviews.title: A great night scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wow, they do a super job. I can use them most of the time without the infrared turned on. When turned on you can see details almost 200 feet away. Two things I noticed. If using through a closed window the light will reflect back unless right next to the glass and It took some practice to learn to use the buttons by feel. I didn't have a problem with the off button but I've sure took a lot of photos by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Rackon

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 both got sent back non working
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these both did not work properly. Sent them back for a refund. Don’t go cheap with the night vision or you will only see dark!
customer_reviews.author: The Hudson’s

customer_reviews.title: I think the optics are great and the zoom feature works well
customer_reviews.text: I think the optics are great and the zoom feature works well, however the battery life is horrible. I can’t understand a great monocular couldn’t solve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Double b

customer_reviews.title: Did not regret the purchase
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 if I can. It is good, but not perfect. Good things: battery lasts longer than I expected. does what it says, takes pictures of the distant objects. good looking. easy to carry. light weight. not so great: I did adjust both eye piece and the lens, the picture is just not sharp, especially the edge of color (like the autumn leaves) is not clear. picture taken is not able to compare with a regular camera. Question: what is the right way to hold the camera? it is like holding a SLR camera--put the left hand underneath to adjust the zoom/focus, left hand pressing the buttons?
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: After owning for 10 years a gen 3 night vision device , this digital IR device came in relatively useless number one problem being does not work wellwhen looking through a pane of glass. the design is over complicated with too many buttons and too many settings instead of simply just being a reliable night vision device. That being said if you still want to purchase one of these call me I'll sell you mine cheap.
customer_reviews.author: ed flueger

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. Built durable
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Built durable. A lot of capability for the price. You truly can see very clearly up to 300 yards in pitch dark with your infrared turned on. Daytime and nighttime use not sensitive to light. No tubes to burn out. memory card capable with photograph and video capability. Limited quality on video and pictures still great value. Don't bother buying an extra infrared flashlight, the one that this comes with is more than capable and far superior to any under a hundred bucks
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Didnt do what i had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I read an article where a guy mounted this on his AR and a red dot infront of it making it usable as a night optic that worked well as a great aiming device that could be used in the dark. I was never able to see the red dot through this monocular.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The night vision is great once you get the vision right - just such a small picture/view.
customer_reviews.text: The picture is so small and we have a difficult time adjusting the distance to get the picture clear. The night vision is great once you get the vision right - just such a small picture/view.
customer_reviews.author: S. Henry

customer_reviews.title: I love the product
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. Bought due to Made in USA in description as opposed to a copy model $100 less. When my product arrived had Bushnell logo. But also had Made in CHINA on the back of monocular. Very disappointed. Shipping was as described. I used the monocular. Very clear and great when used. Exactly as described, expected nothing less received nothing more. Specs are right on.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! I was looking for something that would allow ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I was looking for something that would allow me to see what those glowing eyes were in the backyard. I get a very clear picture of the deer that are 100+ yards away. The digital zoom isn't the greatest, but never expect digital zoom to be.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Mount needs to be included.
customer_reviews.text: Fov is a little ass but if you're gonna use it for night "sniping" mounting on a rifle for long range night shooting would be great, if it came with a mount. Also it eats batteries like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to operate!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an engineer with a lifetime of experience in using this type of equipment. He feels like he has wasted a lot of time on something that simply doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.author: julie bair

customer_reviews.title: best yet
customer_reviews.text: this is my third night vision and without a doubt the best the images are sharp and in black and white no greenish cast like others it takes 4aa batteries and it has a zoom and memory card slot for taking stills and the viewfinder brightness is adjustable and it has a one year warranty
customer_reviews.author: john alexander

customer_reviews.title: amazing optics missing important feature though!!
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy with this it works amazing in day and night can see far far away and its actually very clear def suprises me sometimes but it would have gotten 5 stars if it would have the date and time (timestamp) that made it almost useless for what i intended it for, if there is any way i can get it to have a timestamp i may not have to go to another company!!!
customer_reviews.author: shaun courville

customer_reviews.title: Own The Night
customer_reviews.text: Very nice night eyes. Good battery life, and unfazed by the occasional bright light. It does have a narrow field of vision, however, so don't order too high a magnification from your choice menu. I've also used the item to take photos using the digital night imagery, and they have all come out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Usagi3

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could watch the deer that come into the yard at night. Has a good length of view - I can see all the way to the end of my yard with is over 700', though the width of view isnt very wide. Great little device for the money.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with an 850nm IR Illuminator
customer_reviews.text: Good up to 300m using its built-in illuminator but not compatible with the more powerful external Super Tac IR 850nm illuminator
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Incredible..
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a couple years now. Simply amazing. In the right conditions its effective up too several hundred yards.
customer_reviews.author: Chopperfingers

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly good value for money, need to have adjustment of brightness on LCD screen. I am going to add one or two film filters to dim image, because of excessive brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Press*2012

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works good, only issue was the video recording it would not show clearly when transferring to a computer to view.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I can see things happening now,  before they get to me. It  definitely keeps me safe or at night!
customer_reviews.text: I love this night vision, I do night security I see things now before I couldn’t see because of the darkness! It definitely keeps me safer at night with all those crooks and bad people running around!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bates

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: night vision is good for distances beyond 100 yards. This style however; NOT good for distances within 100 yards.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the unit was smaller and could be mounted on a helmet, but at best, this works well for a tripod mount. It did not come with a rifle/picatinny mount and am waiting for bushnell to contact me back about ordering the part. It works however, and I love the external battery pack capabilities, but it is what it is. :(
customer_reviews.author: ArrSea Defense

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. The image is little bit grainy but unless you are wanting to spend a ton of money, this would be the one to get. It's been a nice little addition for my AR.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Julian

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: ... display is to bright and you can not preserve your own night vision after looking at the bright display... red ir light is very visible ... yes you can see good in the dark with it but not what I was hopeing for...
customer_reviews.author: Birdaprey

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay but I would try something else
customer_reviews.text: I can see things I never would of seen but when you try an zoom it get really fuzzy also when I try an take pictures of like a buck you can’t even see its horns in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: works pretty good for the price..battery life not to good but i connect a power pack to it and get lots of time with it then
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Great viewing distance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see what type predators are killing my chickens. I can see clear to the other side of my property on the lowest IR1 setting. It is a bit bigger than I thought it would be. I was thinking about having it in my go bag, but it is to big and heavy and I can use that space and weight for more important items. You wont be disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: So awesome i always wondered what is in the dark when i set in blind and wait for light. Now ill know i can see Seen 2 acres to to the back of moms house
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: ... only used it a few times but it works better then I expected and has good features zoom etc
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it a few times but it works better then I expected and has good features zoom etc. I will say one thing for sure, that the technology has done leaps and bounds dollar for dollar compared what was available just a few short years ago, The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was I have not had the time to use all the features
customer_reviews.author: Bikers56flh

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: This is really fun for night time viewing. I live in the woods so its nice to grab these and look around to see what is making tge dog bark late at night.
customer_reviews.author: Winkel

customer_reviews.title: It showed up in time.
customer_reviews.text: I love it at frist I didn't but after reading the instructions over a few times it really works nice .no issues
customer_reviews.author: Wj Strutt

customer_reviews.title: Not what you expect.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, you get what you pay for. It works. That's why I gave it 3 stars. But it's not very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Night vision works great but..
customer_reviews.text: The night vision part is great but it has a very narrow field of view which makes spotting difficult. When Bushnell makes a wide field of view version of this they will have a hit on their hands
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Barbosa

customer_reviews.title: Sorry....it's just not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but the Equinox Z is just not worth the money. The picture is very grainy and the display is very odd. All you see is a small rectangular screen inside the 'monocular'. It's like looking at a 12" black and white t.v. screen at the other end of a train tunnel. I will say that Amazon does have a good return policy. It was hassle free and fairly quick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is bad to the bone
customer_reviews.text: This thing is bad to the bone, a little bright on the eyes but you can see great at a pretty far distance in black night conditions.
customer_reviews.author: BG24

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to get a gen 1 night ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to get a gen 1 night vision device this is the one to get. at least you can zoom and take video to show everyone what you saw.
customer_reviews.author: Cimbo

customer_reviews.title: horrible, bought last November
customer_reviews.text: horrible, bought last November. used only three times. Batteries go dead after only 15 minutes of use, even after using the more expensive batteries. should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allows vision in the darkest rooms or nights.
customer_reviews.text: This small night vision viewer / camera allows clear sight in the darkest of nights or rooms. The red IR connected to is makes it visible to a careful searcher. It is not ideal for secret spying. Magnification of 6 times makes it an option for a common gun rail sight (without a reticle).
customer_reviews.author: John W. Leggett

customer_reviews.title: Was locking up!
customer_reviews.text: After taking a picture it would lock up (screen would turn green/pink) and had to remove batteries. Called Bushnell several times and was told that unit was defective! I finally read somewhere about trying a freshly formated memory card and that fixed the problem. They could only read the instructions and politely told me to follow them. I'll now try the unit out and see how it does.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap Night vision
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work pretty well. Do wish that I bought the less zoom version as this zooms in too far for my tastes.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad night vision for price. Unit is pretty heavy though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura T.

customer_reviews.title: Considerably better than the previous Equinox series
customer_reviews.text: Considerably better than the previous Equinox series. The IR light is super bright compared to the older one, no need to buy an additional one like I had to for the older model. One of my complaints is that the visible red light emitted from the IR, its bright and easily noticeable, its fairly large so it makes it even more noticeable. Record feature works great. Another complaint is the viewing screen is bright, and I mean really bright. They just had an update that now offers a low and high setting, but it is still far to bright. Overall great little introductory night vision especially in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes! They're great!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Better than expected, especially from having read some of these other reviews! I'm guessing some folks either got the batteries in wrong or failed to turn on the IR lamp. We watch elk in the mountains and this works magnificently. (NO! I don't work for Bushnell, nor Amazon, nor do I sell these or anything like them)
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Richardson

customer_reviews.title: We use them for night hunting and they work great. Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: Between me and a friend of mine, we own 5 of these. We use them for night hunting and they work great. Very impressive. We often mount them on tripods and use the video-out to view the video on a small monitor. The monitor is powered by a small, motorocycle type 12 volt battery.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! I am so impressed with the infrared night vision picture quality. This was purchase for hunting to scout deer early before and late after the hunt. I like that I can use it during the day as well. It is digital so the daytime view is not as sharp but it's still a great product that I strongly recommend. It has made a huge difference in walking to the stand early in the morning in the dark. I don't have to worry about scaring the deer off now bc I can see them long before they see me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Lott

customer_reviews.title: Great night vision!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I use this every night at work, and it's crystal clear. I can see in total darkness a couple hundred yards away without giving away my position. I definite recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: David Renna

customer_reviews.title: TO POWERFULL
customer_reviews.text: well believe it or not this scope is to good, I think you could scope out a mouse at 100 yards, I bought it to look around in the large creek behind my house, but close field of view is not good so scope is hard to use for my purpose, not if you want to scope out a cat several blocks down the street its perfect, very clear and sharp, I took some pics with it and they were good, so really good at longer distances maybe 30 yards to at least 100 maybe more
customer_reviews.author: Ann A Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Way better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first since it's at such a low cost but....easily can see a coyote at 500yds, could tell the difference between a coyote and cow at 1000yds. Anything under 300yds is super clear. Pretty excited to try this out down in texas on hogs.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob edwards

customer_reviews.title: It would work good if you're just watching a bait pile
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for coyote hunting however the FOV turned out to be too tight for scanning. It would work good if you're just watching a bait pile. Picture was great, as is expected with digital. I ended up returning the product in favor of something with more field of view which better fit my application.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Feels rugged and well-made, and works extremely well. ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels rugged and well-made, and works extremely well. I spotted a rabbit in pitch black from maybe a few hundred feet away on my first night taking it out. You should probably have an alibi if you're wandering around late at night with this though. If anyone asks, you're looking for your friend's cat or something.
customer_reviews.author: roulette475

customer_reviews.title: takes pics an it records video nice zoom, an for the price of all this
customer_reviews.text: hard to go wrong with these,day an night vision,yes you do have limitations at night but has a very clear image with clarity,takes pics an it records video nice zoom,an for the price of all this,thats why its hard to go wrong
customer_reviews.author: ald

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ, just be sure to look at buying the gun mount package deal before making a purchase. The mount, discontinued by Bushnell, was $60 from a third party provider.
customer_reviews.author: b.gardner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bushnell Night
customer_reviews.text: I had a Stealth Night Vision and it was okay but when I got this Bushnell night vision it's Awesome looking in its sooo good and clear at day time and at night too. It's best for the money in a long run to get one like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Proved me wrong
customer_reviews.text: I am about the most picky judgmental person there is when it comes to products and after reading some of the terrible reviews I seriously had my doubts so believe me when I say that I am quite pleased with this product. the only downfalls thus far is the short battery life, awkwardness in your hand, and the minimum 4 power zoom but day & night the image is clear , crisp and far. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: JIMMYA

customer_reviews.title: View is very good although I've never looked thru night vision optics before ...
customer_reviews.text: View is very good although I've never looked thru night vision optics before so I don't have anything to compare it to. I use IR3 because using IR2 shows1/3 battery life left and IR1 shows no battery life left - even with brand new batteries. I have alkaline batters in it right now and that may be the issue. Overall though, I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Night vision monoc
customer_reviews.text: It delivers what it promises. I wish now I'd gotten one with lower magnification as it's difficult to hold steady even at its lowest setting. I wanted the other features (recording capabilities, tripod mount, AA batteries) that I couldn't find on others at comparable price, so chose this model.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Nartker

customer_reviews.title: Beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This performed better then i imagined. Hooked it up to a small portable tv for easier viewing. Very clear in pitch dark!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I thought it would. A lot of fun to use. Can see animals at 200-300 yds no problem. Quality recording of stills or video.
customer_reviews.author: MD Ron

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use but it eats batteries and only lasted one hunting season
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use but it eats batteries...you will only want to use it for short periods of time in order to conserve your battery. Update 12/31/2015, tried using it last night after replacing batteries and nothing...did not light up...So now I'm not so pleased I only got one hunting season out of it before it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: My husband wanted this. He is an avid hunter ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted this. He is an avid hunter & it helps aid in his dusk vision & seeing what animals are approaching that can't be seen. At 70 yards, pitch black, he saw our little lab mix dog wagging her tail out at the back field. Still learning the adjustments but overall it is a purchase he does not regret.
customer_reviews.author: MKM

customer_reviews.title: Good night scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good night scope for the money. More than I expected with good clarity over distance. The only thing is it is 'touchy' when you first try and set it up. When you take that batteries out to store it or replace them when they are used up, the scope doesn't always go back to the 'tuned in' setting you had so much trouble to get to in the beginning. Not sure what causes that. Sometimes it's not far out. Other times it's hard to find the 'sweet spot' again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice but I don’t like that drains the battery fast and if you use full zoom gets shaky
customer_reviews.author: Walnut

customer_reviews.title: Over all ii is a good product and I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised but is a little fuzzy. After looking at it for a while you loose your night vision but I guess it is to be expected. You really need a tripod for the 6x magnification; it is a little wobbly. It works well for what I bought it for which is spoting hogs. Over all ii is a good product and I would buy it again. You cannot beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Never used nightvision before amazing how illuminated everything looks . Perfect for what I needed would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: MRBrown

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. But was hoping to be able to see more area which makes it hard to scan the area quickly. May keep using it for a bit but likely will return it for some thing better.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, but
customer_reviews.text: Not as expected. Either I couldn't get them to work or they were defective. I'm no rocket scientist, but I think they were defective. Nice size, but...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best NV Monocular I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: By far the best NV Monocular I have ever had. I can easily see and identify to 200 yds with built in illuminator. With a Wicked illuminator 300 yds is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sawmiller

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is great. I use it to hunt hogs at night. I can see and clearly identify animals up to 250-300 yards. It's a lot of fun to see what all is out there at night. Big thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Bigbore

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: You absolutely can't beat this for the money. Dollar for dollar this little monocular does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Dmil

customer_reviews.title: Video Problem Resolved
customer_reviews.text: After my initial review I was contacted by Bushnell customer support regarding a problem with the video out function. The unit would shut off after 10 minutes while the video out was in use. Bushnell provided me with the software and instructions to update the firmware. The video out function is now working as it should. The Bushnell Z is now living up to it's full potential. A great night vision scope that operates day or night in full color or IR with the capability for internal video recording or capture......Awsome. I base this review on my many years in the surveillance field as a police detective and private investigator.
customer_reviews.author: Florida_Lawdog

customer_reviews.title: But everything was in there and looked fine. He was so surprised and excited when he ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my husband. It arrived very quickly. When I opened the Amazon box the product box looked to have been opened, the seal was broken. But everything was in there and looked fine. He was so surprised and excited when he opened it on Christmas, he couldn't wait to test it out, said the night vision is great! We can't wait for our next camping trip!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get to use this product much. The image looked blurry and fuzzy. Focusing was poor and inadequate. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

product_meta.title: Bushnell Night Vision_Equinox Z Monocular
feature_bullets: Digital Night Vision monocular with 6x magnification, 1-3x digital zoom and a 50mm objective lens
Day or nighttime use (Daytime color with IR off); built in Infrared Illuminator for long distance viewing up to a 1000 ft. viewing distance
Multicoated glass objectives produces outstanding optical clarity; Picatinny style rail for accessory mounting
Video out capability; video recording and image capture using up to 32GB Micro SD Card (sold separately). Recoil tested to 350 g
Rugged water-resistant housing; tripod mountable; operates on 4 AA batteries (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
